required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stereotactic Ablative Radiotherapy for Refractory Ventricular Tachycardia
clinical_study.official_title: Stereotactic Ablative Radiotherapy (SABR) for Refractory Ventricular Tachycardia - a Phase I/II Study

brief_summary.textblock: Single arm, phase Ib/2a dose escalation study with an expansion cohort to determine the maximal tolerated dose (MTD) for stereotactic ablative radiotherapy of targets in the cardiac myocardium and to make a preliminary assessment of the efficacy of the treatment. The dose escalation will be guided by Time-to-Event Continual Reassessment Method (TITE-CRM) to ensure more patients will be spared dose limiting toxicities and more patients will be entered on the dose level that will be chosen as minimal dose of maximal effect. This design also allows for continual accrual of patients when delayed adverse events may be observed.

primary_outcome.measure: ICD (Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator) Shock Free Survival
primary_outcome.description: ICD (implantable cardioverter defibrillator) shock free survival at six months

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Salvage Definitive Anti-arrhythmia Therapy (Cardiac Transplant)
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of salvage definitive anti-arrhythmia therapy (cardiac transplant) over 5 years.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Return of Ventricular Tachycardia Requiring Defibrillation, Intravenous Drug Therapy or Readmission to Hospital
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of return of ventricular tachycardia requiring defibrillation, intravenous drug therapy or readmission to hospital over 5 years
Incidence of ICD shocks 12 months post-SABR procedure

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of Decline of LV Ejection Fraction by More Than 5% on Two Consecutive Echocardiograms
other_outcome.description: Incidence of decline of LV ejection fraction by more than 5% on two consecutive echocardiograms over 5 years

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of Persistent Increase in Baseline Supplemental Oxygen Requirement by 1L for a Duration of >3 Months
other_outcome.description: Incidence of persistent increase in baseline supplemental oxygen requirement by 1L for a duration of >3 months over 5 years

other_outcome.measure: Incidence of Steroid Use for Radiotherapy Related Indications

arm_group.description: This is a single-arm, non-blinded study.

intervention.description: A single fraction of radiation is delivered using a clinical radiotherapy system capable of stereotactic radiotherapy to the chest, with on-board image guided radiotherapy capabilities, respiratory motion management, and Intensity Modulated Radiotherapy Treatment (IMRT) planning.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Documented sustained ventricular arrhythmias refractory to or not a suitable candidate for catheter based RFA ablative therapy
- Documented sustained ventricular arrhythmias refractory to or not a suitable candidate for cardiac sympathetic denervation therapy
- Documented ventricular arrhythmias refractory to or not a suitable candidate for cardiac transplantation
- Documented sustained ventricular arrhythmias refractory to or not a suitable candidate for additional medical management
- ICD in place with documented episodes recurrent VT despite best clinical management previous refusal of ICD with recurrent sustained ventricular arrhythmias
- If ischemic cardiomyopathy, myocardial infarction occurred more than one month prior to enrollment
- No history of prior radiotherapy to the chest
- Prescribed dose must be deliverable using SABR technique
- Age â‰¥ 18 years
- Karnofsky Performance Status (KPS) > 70
- If a woman is of childbearing potential, a negative serum pregnancy test must be documented. Women of childbearing potential must agree to use adequate contraception (hormonal or barrier method of birth control; or abstinence) for at least 4 weeks after study treatment.
- Ability to understand and willingness to sign a written informed consent

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Stereotactic Ablation Treatment Arm
group.description: This is a single-arm, non-blinded study. Stereotactic Ablative Radiotherapy (SABR): A single fraction of radiation is delivered using a clinical radiotherapy system capable of stereotactic radiotherapy to the chest, with on-board image guided radiotherapy capabilities, respiratory motion management, and Intensity Modulated Radiotherapy Treatment (IMRT) planning.

baseline.population: Documented sustained ventricular arrhythmias refractory to or not suitable for cardiac transplantation, cardiac sympathetic denervation therapy, catheter based RFA ablative therapy or other medical management.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
